---
title: "graphs"
format: pdf
---
```{r}
library(ggplot2)

# Data for -log(x)
df <- data.frame(x = seq(0.001, 1, length.out = 1000))  # avoid log(0)
df$y <- -log(df$x)

ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  # Line of -log(x)
  geom_line(color = "#41b6e6", linewidth = 1.2) +
  # Shaded area under the curve
  geom_area(fill = "#41b6e6", alpha = 0.1) +
  geom_vline(xintercept=0.002, colour = "red", linewidth = 1.35) +
  
  # Title and axis labels
  labs(
    title = "Negative Log-Likelihood",
    x = "x",
    y = "-log(x)"
  ) +
  
  # Zoom out a bit from exact bounds
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 1), expand = c(0, 0)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 5), expand = c(0, 0)) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 1), ylim = c(0, 5), clip = "off") +
  
  # Dark theme with white panel border
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    panel.background = element_rect(color = NA, fill = "gray10"),
    panel.border = element_rect(color = "white", fill = NA, linewidth = 0.8),
    plot.background = element_rect(color = "gray10", fill = "gray10"),
    
    plot.title = element_text(family = "Space Grotesk",
                              face = "bold",
                              color = "white",
                              size = 18),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    
    panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    
    axis.title = element_text(family = "Space Grotesk",
                              face = "bold",
                              color = "white",
                              size = 16),
    axis.text = element_text(family = "Space Grotesk",
                             color = "white",
                             size = 14),
    
    axis.ticks = element_line(color = "white", linewidth = 0.8),
    axis.ticks.length = unit(5, "pt"),
    
    plot.margin = margin(8, 18, 5, 10)
  )

ggsave("neg_log_plot.png", width = 8, height = 6, dpi = 300)
```
